intro: Vincetoxicum intermedium, commonly known as the common false bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its berries are orange-red and contain toxic seeds, which can be harmful to livestock and humans if ingested. Vincetoxicum intermedium is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
